string-array.name: recipe0
string-array.item: Prepare brownie mix according to directions on package. Bake in 9x13 pan at 350 degrees for 28-30 min. Top with marshmallows and bake 3 minutes longer (marshmallows will not be completely melted). FROSTING: Combine chips, peanut butter, and butter in sauce pan and cook until melted. Take off stove and add cereal. Spread over marshmallows. Cool 2 hours.

string-array.name: recipe1
string-array.item: Beat egg yolks, salt and water until thick. Fold in sugar, 1 tsp vanilla and lemon extract. Fold in flour. Shake 2 tsp baking powder over dough and beat in.

string-array.name: recipe2
string-array.item: 1. In 2 qt. baking dish (11x7) spread 1 cup sauce. Top with 3 dry noodles, ricotta cheese, 1 cup mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese and 1 cup sauce. Top with remaining dry noodles and sauce. Cover. 2. Bake at 375 degrees 1 hr. Top with remaining mozzarella cheese. Let stand 5 min. Serves 6.

string-array.name: recipe3
string-array.item: Heat olive oil in a heavy skillet over high heat until it just begins to smoke. Place shrimp in an even layer on the bottom of the pan and cook for 1 minute without stirring. Season shrimp with salt; cook and stir until shrimp begin to turn pink, about 1 minute. Stir in garlic and red pepper flakes; cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in lemon juice, caper brine, 1 1/2 teaspoon cold butter, and half the parsley. Cook until butter has melted, about 1 minute, then turn heat to low and stir in 1 1/2 tablespoon cold butter. Cook and stir until all butter has melted to form a thick sauce and shrimp are pink and opaque, about 2 to 3 minutes. Remove shrimp with a slotted spoon and transfer to a bowl; continue to cook butter sauce, adding water 1 teaspoon at a time if too thick, about 2 minutes. Season with salt to taste. Serve shrimp topped with the pan sauce. Garnish with remaining flat-leaf parsley.
